stimulusHtml: Daily Tools is a typical firm in a monopolistically competitive market that produces tool kits for everyday use. Which of the following explains why Daily Tools is inefficient in long-run equilibrium?
choicesHtml: The entry of more efficient firms is blocked.
The firm produces the quantity at which marginal cost equals average total cost.
The firm does not produce the quantity that results in minimum average total cost.
The firm does not produce the quantity that minimizes total cost.
